message:
You have always inspired us to push our limits further, work harder and strive harder to make Kshitij a grand success. We thank you for your leadership and all the insights that you have given us. You have always been a motivating mentor, helpful senior and a true friend. With your blessings and guidance, Kshitij will surely reach new horizons.

Thank You!!
#KTJ_Forever

KSHITIJ, IIT KHARAGPUR apologises to all who were eagerly waiting to gain wisdom from this legendary man.

Kshitij, IIT Kharagpur in association with Kharagpur Open Source Society (KOSS) is happy to announce the second edition of the Open Source Summit (https://kwoc.kossiitkgp.org/summit) to be held on 19th and 20th January.

Below is the schedule for workshops and talks - 

Day 1,19th Jan:
- 10 am to 1 pm
- Python: NR 221
- JavaScript: NR 223
Prerequisites for the above courses: Basic programming knowledge in any language. 
- 2 pm to 5 pm
Talk cum Workshop by Peter Thomas, Intuit: NR 221
Mr. Peter Thomas is a distinguished engineer at Intuit who will be giving a hands-on workshop and talk about API testing and Karate.

Day 2, 20th Jan:

- 10 am to 1 pm
- Business Analytics/Data Science Workshop: NR 221.
One should have basic python knowledge for this workshop.
- Go Workshop: NR 223
- 2 pm to 4 pm 
- Hacking and Web Security: NR 221
- 4 pm to 5 pm
- Talks: NR 221

Check out https://kwoc.kossiitkgp.org/summit to know more

Gear up for this weekend as Kshitij and KOSS bring to you an awesome opportunity to learn a bundle of awesome stuff.

Happy coding!

Prize Money: INR 15,000

"Good, bad or indifferent, if you are not investing in new technology, you are going to be left behind." Keeping this in mind, Kshitij, IIT Kharagpur always displays the latest technologies from all around the world in front of the brightest minds. Kshitij, IIT Kharagpur in association with Sirena Technologies announces its first exhibition.
Exhibition Lineup-
First in line is Nino Robot, an affordable humanoid robot focused on improving education.
Next up is Perro, a Robotic dog.
The third is Spyder, a Robotic spider.
The fourth is Vood, a virtual assistant to help you throughout your day.
Stay tuned for more exhibition.
#Exhibition_1
#KTJ2k19

Containerization offers a form of operating system virtualization that allows developers to package up all or part of an application, effectively into a portable building block, to move fast, deploy software efficiently, and operate at an unprecedented scale.
Kshitij, IIT Kharagpur in association with NetApp present a workshop on "Cloud Native SaaS & Simplifying Container Orchestration in Cloud with Kubernetes" to help various organizations build and run SaaS applications at the same time simplifying the management of containers in a hybrid cloud environment for both stateless and stateful applications.

P.S.: The workshop is absolutely free of cost.
Register at www.ktj.in/menu/workshops

MindSphere is an open cloud platform developed for applications in the context of the Internet of Things. MindSphere stores operational data and makes it accessible through digital applications (“MindApps”) to allow industrial customers to make decisions based on valuable factual information. The system is used in applications such as automated production and vehicle fleet management.
Kshitij, IIT Kharagpur and Siemens presents 'Industry 4.0 Midsphere' Hackathon, Which provides you with an unparalleled opportunity to solve real-world problems using the concepts of MindSphere

Prize Money: INR 90,000

Robotic Soccer is an example of complex tasks in which multiple agents need to collaborate in an adversarial environment to achieve specific objectives. It offers a challenging research domain to investigate a large spectrum of issues relevant to the development of complete autonomous agents.
Kshitij, IIT Kharagpur & GE Digital in association with Kharagpur RoboSoccer Students' Group (KRSSG) presents Code-O-Soccer, a simulation-based strategy coding competition, where soccer strategies brewing within one's mind are implemented on a robot.

Prizes worth INR 50,000
Register at https://ktj.in/ > events > code conclave > code-o-soccer
For more details visit http://event.krssg.in/index.php
Submit your codes before 7th January 2019

Ubiquitous little black chips, which are the heart and brain of complex electronic circuits ICs, integrate the highest level of software intelligence with hardware optimization and any-to-any connectivity.
Thus, Kshitij, IIT Kharagpur in association with Xilinx, Inc.. is introducing its new event Xilinx Innovation Challenge of building an application which provides the solution for the real-life problem using python in conjunction with the Xilinx PYNQ platform. PYNQ is an open-source project from Xilinx that makes it easy to design embedded systems with Zynq Systems on Chips (SoCs).

Prize Money - INR 90,000
Register at: https://ktj.in/  -> events -> conceptualize -> Xilinx Innovation Challenge
Submission Deadline: 10/12/2018
Submit your abstract at submissions@ktj.in

We are happy to announce that Kharagpur Open Source Society - KOSS is hosting Kharagpur Winter of Code (KWoC) 2018, in association with Kshitij, IIT Kharagpur. 
KWoC is a December long online program, open to students from all colleges. For those who already know about Google Summer of Code, KWoC is going to be very helpful for you. 

For those who don't know about such open source programs, KWoC is a platform where you are going to learn about a new style of collaborative software development. Read more on the website.
In simple steps:
- Register yourself.
- Go through the projects.
- Choose one/two you want to work on.
- Contact the mentor of the project.
- Contribute!

We also invite enthusiastic mentors from all places to guide and share their knowledge and help students.
We are very glad to announce that both the student and mentor registration portals have now open 
Kshitij official Facebook Page https://www.facebook.com/ktj.iitkgp/
Head over to https://kwoc.kossiitkgp.org for student registration.
Head over to https://kwoc.kossiitkgp.org/mentor_form for mentor registration.
Previous Experience -> https://kwoc.kossiitkgp.org/testimonials

"With great powers come great responsibility"

Marvel Comics will no longer be the same. The familiar ridiculous alliteration, painstaking loquaciousness and carnival barker rhythm missing in the comics will always remind us of Stan Lee.

Stan Lee gave us more than comics, he gave us 'creeds to live by'. We owe Stan Lee a huge debt of gratitude for devoting his life to giving us stories to live by.

#RIP_StanLee
#Excelsior

Kshitij, IIT Kharagpur conducted yet another edition of the Kolkata Robotics workshop at Vidyamandir Auditorium on 4th November.

We are very thankful to Ms Moon Moon Sen who graced the Workshop with her presence and interacted with the students, encouraging them towards technology. 

This festive season for the students of Kolkata has begun with an opportunity to dive into the sea of Robotics and technology in the most ingenious way. With many more opportunities to come in the 16th edition of Kshitij, we would like to thank Kolkata for the overwhelming response and the full house auditorium. 

#Kolkata_Workshop
#KTJ2k19

The wait is over!!
Kshitij, IIT Kharagpur is back with the 3rd edition of its regional Kascade, which will be conducted in the major cities across India in mid-October.
Prelims of the flagship events Nightshift, Math-Olympiad, Source Code, and Anadigix will be conducted. Teams that will be shortlisted in the prelims will be guaranteed a direct entry in the final round to be held at IIT Kharagpur during Kshitij in 18th-20th January 2019. Start preparing and beat the competition.
#Kascade
#KTJ2k19

Design Credits: Goutham Pati

Walking freely on the streets, we experience a sense of freedom, a wave of happiness around us. The reason behind these millions of smiles is none other than this eminent personality. Born on 2nd of October and later came to be known as the Father of the Nation - Mohandas Karamchand Gandhi, lovingly addressed as BAPU. Kshitij, IIT Kharagpur wishes you all a Happy Gandhi Jayanti.
#150thAnniversaryofGandhiJayanti

To know all about Kshitij, be there at Kalidas, today at 9pm and become a part of something extravagant.

message:
A dad is someone who wants to catch you before you fall, but instead picks you up, brushes you off, and lets you try again. A dad is someone who wants to keep you from making mistakes but instead lets you find your own way, even though his heart breaks in silence when you get hurt. A dad is not a hero. He is a silent guardian, a watchful protector, he is a dark knight. 
Kshitij, IIT Kharagpur wishes a very happy father's day to all the superdads.
#Happy_Fathers_Day
#KTJ2k19

The 15th edition of Asia's Largest  Techno Management Symposium, held from 19th to 21st January, was a grand success. A trip down the memory lane of those blissful moments make them alive again. We would like to express our visitors. participants and collaborators. 
A big thank you to our photographers - Your Visual Poest, Adhidev Karan, Arvind Kumar Photography, M & T studios.

Kshitij, IIT Kharagpur reveals its exhibition line up for the 15th edition. 
First in line is the robotic band from Japan which will fuse together,  music and Technology. 

Next up is Team Synergy,  a lunar robot from Croatia and one of the top teams of the Google Lunar XPrize. 

The third exhibition is Indro 3.0,  the tallest humanoid robot of India. 

And last but not the least is a 3D mapping drone from India.

For all the Bollywood cinephiles present out there, the time has come!
Few filmmakers carry a signature style that separates their work from others, and Imtiaz Ali is one of them. His direction of Jab We Met earned him critical and commercial success while Love Aaj Kal and Rockstar made him a noted filmmaker.There is an effortless realism in his films, a sense of ease in which his characters converse - they often tend to verbalise their emotions.

Be there at TOAT on 21st January to learn the other sides of his story, the unspoken lines, and the unwritten verse. 
#KTJ2k18
#Imtiaz_Ali

And the robots are now trying to save the remaining humans in a habitable environment by building an impenetrable fortress. In order to do this, they have to collect all the suitable blocks in the proper order in a given time before they lose any more lives.

Prizes Worth INR 45,000
For more information go to : https://www.robotix.in/event/fortress/

Kshitij, IIT Kharagpur in association with Technology Robotix Society presents you 'Poles Apart'. The engineers are trying to design a vehicle that is capable of adapting itself to the rough terrain it is sent into. You are asked to design the prototype of such a bot that is capable of changing the distance between its wheels so as to cover a ground that cannot be done otherwise. There are multiple valleys that converge, diverge or are in an arc form and are to be crossed. 
Your challenge is to design a bot robust enough to adapt itself according to the valleys it faces. There are also certain parts of the path that you need to complete before you can cover the further ground. Use a mechanical gripper to complete this problem statement.

Prizes Worth INR 45,000
For more information go to: www.robotix.in/event/poles-apart/
Register at www.ktj.in/event
